title.native: 名探偵コナン １４番目の標的

description:
Ran has a nightmare about her mother dying, but starts to remember what really happened involving herself, her mother, and her father from 10 years ago. Meanwhile, people are being injured by a certain culprit. Conan soon realizes that these people all have some kind of relation to Mouri, and that they all had a number in their name corresponding to a playing card and were being targeted in order, from the king down to the ace. The police soon decide that a murderous card dealer who just got out of jail and wanted revenge on Mouri is behind it. However, as injuries become murders and it is a race to predict who the next victims will be, Conan soon finds that the truth is something completely different, while learning about the incident from 10 years ago in the process.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Detective Conan Movie 02: The Fourteenth Target
Meitantei Conan Movie 02: Juuyonbanme no Target
Detective Conan Movie 02: L’asso di picche

node.description:
__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/caitlinsvoice) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/caitlinsvoice/) | [Myspace](https://myspace.com/caitlintiffany) | [Blog](https://kiristokyoto.livejournal.com/)

An American voice actor, voice director, and script writer for Funimation, New Generation Pictures, and Bang Zoom! Entertainment. She's been working in the anime industry since 2004. She grew up in the San Diego area, California, and has been married to Tony Patterson since 2009. Outside of voice acting, Caitlin has worked as an ESL teacher in Spain.

__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

__Alma mater:__ Tokyo Designer Gakuin College (Animation Department)

Freelance animator and anime director. Married to Naoko Shiraishi, ex-Shaft/Gainax producer and founder of the animation studio Millepensee. He has a [weekly column](http://animestyle.jp/column/battari/) at Anime Style.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imozuka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E9%87%8E%E8%81%A1)

Satoshi Ishino is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, character/mechanical designer and animation director.

He started working at Studio Giants, but later went to work at Studio Fantasia before becoming a freelance animator. Today he is a part of the animator group Studio Hercules (スタジオへらくれす), and he's also a part of the doujin circle TEAM Imozuka (TEAM いもずか).

Satoshi is best known for his work as a character designer and animation supervisor in the show Excel Saga and the related Puni Puni Poemi.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%93%E3%81%A0%E3%81%BE%E5%85%BC%E5%97%A3) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenji_Kodama)

Kenji Kodama is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He is best known for being one of the main directors on the long-running anime [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/), as well as the [City Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1470/) series and [Lupin III: Part III](https://anilist.co/anime/1426/).

Married to animator [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choco_kiku) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊地洋子)

Married to [Eiji Suganuma](https://anilist.co/staff/109167/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [Youko Kikuchi (菊地陽子)](https://anilist.co/staff/141535/), different kanji._

Affiliated with Studio Live. Admires [Kazuko Tadano](https://anilist.co/staff/118426/).

Her designs are very shoujo manga like, often featuring glittering eyes.

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sachiko Kamachi, known professionally as Izumi Sakai, was a female Japanese pop singer, songwriter, and member of the group Zard. As Sakai was the only member who stayed in the group while others joined and left regularly, Zard and Sakai may be referred to interchangeably. She was the best-selling female recording artist of the 1990s and has sold over 37 million copies of sales, making her one of the best-selling music artists in Japan of all time.

Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. Six of her albums as well as her first three compilations also surpassed the one-million mark. Sakai's CD sales had been in decline since 2000, but her death triggered an increase in CD sales.

 In June 2006, she was diagnosed with cervical cancer, for which she immediately underwent treatment. She appeared to have healed, but discovered that her cancer had spread to her lungs, indicating a Stage 4 cancer. She began undergoing treatment at Keio University Hospital in April 2007 but she never fully recovered. Sakai died on May 27, 2007 due to an accidental fall at the hospital where she was undergoing chemotherapy.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Joined Audio Planning U in 1982, where he studied under [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/).

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西見祥示郎)

In 1986, Nishimi joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/), where he worked until going freelance in 2003. Since then he has participated on numerous of [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/)'s projects. His illustrations as an amateur became a topic of conversation among creators such as [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), one of the founders of Studio 4°C.
